eu.fbk.dkm.springles.base

Class QuerySpec<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.fbk.dkm.springles.base.QuerySpec<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the result type of the query, as bound to the query QueryType
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public final class QuerySpec<T>
extends Object
implements Serializable
    A query specification.

    This class models the specification of a query (similarly to UpdateSpec that models an update operation specification), combining in a single object both a language-specific string representation (e.g., SPARQL) and the Sesame algebraic representation:

    • the string representation is encoded through properties getString(), getLanguage() and getBaseURI(), the latter being the optional URI used to interpret relative URIs in the update string;
    • the algebraic representation is encoded through properties getExpression(), getDataset() and getNamespaces(); a query has an algebraic tuple expression optionally associated to a dataset (as an effect of FROM clauses) and to a set of namespace declarations.

    In addition, property getType() specifies the type of query, namely a boolean, tuple or graph query.

    A QuerySpec can be created in two ways: either providing its type and string representation (methods from(QueryType, String) and from(QueryType, String, QueryLanguage, String)); or providing its type and algebraic representation (methods from(QueryType, TupleExpr, Dataset) and from(QueryType, TupleExpr, Dataset, Map)). In both case, the dual representation is automatically derived, either via parsing or rendering to SPARQL language:

    • automatic parsing is supported only for QueryLanguages for which a parser is available in Sesame: if it is not the case, property isParsed() will be set to false, the algebraic representation will not be computed and accessing the corresponding three properties will result in an error;
    • automatic rendering of an algebraic expression to a corresponding SPARQL string is always possible; when this happens, property isRendered() is set to true.

    QuerySpec instances are created through the from factory methods which provide for the caching and reuse of already created objects, thus reducing parsing overhead. Serialization is supported, with deserialization attempting to reuse existing objects from the cache. Instances have to considered to be immutable: while it is not possible to (efficiently) forbid modifying the query tuple expression (getExpression()), THE ALGEBRAIC EXPRESSION MUST NOT BE MODIFIED, as this will interfer with caching.

        Private constructor, accepting parameters for all the object properties.
        Parameters:
        type - the query type
        string - the update string
        language - the language the update string is expressed in
        baseURI - the optional base URI, possibly null
        rendered - true if the update string was rendered
        expression - the algebraic expression, null if the query cannot be parsed
        dataset - the associated dataset, null if cannot be parsed or left unspecified
        namespaces - the namespace declarations, null if the query cannot be parsed

                    String string)
                         throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
        Returns a QuerySpec for the specified query type and SPARQL query string. This is a convenience method corresponding to from(type, string, QueryLanguage.SPARQL, null).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the result type of the query, as bound to the query type
        Parameters:
        type - the query type
        string - the query string, in SPARQL and without relative URIs
        Returns:
        the corresponding QuerySpec
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException - in case the string has syntax errors

      • getString

        public String getString()
        Returns the query string. The returned string is expressed in language getLanguage() and possibly automatically rendered (isRendered() true) from a supplied algebraic expression.
        Returns:
        the update string

      • getLanguage

        public org.openrdf.query.QueryLanguage getLanguage()
        Returns the language the query string is expressed in. If the string has been automatically rendered from a supplied algebraic expression, the language is QueryLanguage.SPARQL .
        Returns:
        the language

      • getBaseURI

        @Nullable
public String getBaseURI()
        Returns the optional base URI to be used to interpret relative URIs in the query string. The base URI can be null, in which case it is assumed that the query string does not contain relative URIs.
        Returns:
        the base URI, possibly null

      • isRendered

        public boolean isRendered()
        Returns true if the query string has been rendered starting from a supplied algebraic expression.
        Returns:
        true if the query string has been rendered

      • isParsed

        public boolean isParsed()
        Returns true if the algebraic representation of the query is available. This representation may be unavailable in case a query string has been supplied, whose language has not an associated Sesame parser.
        Returns:
        true if the algebraic representation is available

      • getExpression

        public org.openrdf.query.algebra.TupleExpr getExpression()
                                                  throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns the algebraic expression for the query - DON'T MODIFY THE RESULT. As a query expression must be cached for performance reasons, modifying it would affect all subsequent operations on the same QuerySpec object, so CLONE THE EXPRESSION BEFORE MODIFYING IT.
        Returns:
        the algebraic expression for this query.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - in case the algebraic representation is unavailable

      • getDataset

        @Nullable
public org.openrdf.query.Dataset getDataset()
                                     throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns the dataset associated to the algebraic expression, or null if such dataset has not been explicitly specified.
        Returns:
        the dataset, possibly null
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - in case the algebraic representation is unavailable

      • getNamespaces

        public Map<String,String> getNamespaces()
                                 throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns the namespace declarations for the query.
        Returns:
        a map of prefix -> namespace declarations
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - in case the algebraic representation is unavailable

      • enforceDataset

        public QuerySpec<T> enforceDataset(org.openrdf.query.Dataset dataset)
                            throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns a QuerySpec with the same query expression of this specification, but associated to the dataset specified.
        Parameters:
        dataset - the dataset to be enforced, null to associate to an unspecified dataset
        Returns:
        the resulting QuerySpec object (possibly this if no change is required)
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - in case the algebraic representation of this is unavailable
